org.kawanfw.commons.api.server

Class DefaultCommonsConfigurator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kawanfw.commons.api.server.DefaultCommonsConfigurator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommonsConfigurator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SshAuthCommonsConfigurator

    public class DefaultCommonsConfigurator
extends Object
implements CommonsConfigurator
    Default implementation of the commons User Configuration for the KawanSoft Frameworks.

    This defaults implementation will help for a quick start and to test the KawanSoft Frameworks, but please note that is implementation is not secure at all.
    Especially: the login method will always return true.

    So:

    • The forceSecureHttp method should be set to true by your implementation in order to prevent the login info and the data to be send in clear over the Internet with http protocol frameworks.
    • The login method should be overridden by your specific implementation or using SshAuthCommonsConfigurator implementation.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nicolas de Pomereu
    See Also:
    SshAuthCommonsConfigurator

    • Method Detail

      • forceSecureHttp

        public boolean forceSecureHttp()
        Description copied from interface: CommonsConfigurator
        Allows to define if the host URL must be accessed in secured httpS. If true, the server side (ServerFileManager or ServerSqlManager Servlet) will ask the client side to convert the url scheme from "http" to secure "https" for all server requests. This will be done automatically on the client side prior to authentication.
        Specified by:
        forceSecureHttp in interface CommonsConfigurator
        Returns:
        false. (Client programs will be allowed to send unsecured http requests).

      • getBannedUsernames

        public Set<String> getBannedUsernames()
                               throws IOException,
                                      SQLException
        Description copied from interface: CommonsConfigurator
        Allows to define the set of banned usernames. The server side will refuse access to client programs calling with a username in the set.
        Specified by:
        getBannedUsernames in interface CommonsConfigurator
        Returns:
        Empty HashSet. (No banned IP usernames.)
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IOException occurs
        SQLException - if a SQLException occurs

      • getIPsBlacklist

        public List<String> getIPsBlacklist()
                             throws IOException,
                                    SQLException
        Description copied from interface: CommonsConfigurator
        Allows to define the blacklist of banned IP addresses. The server side will refuse access to client programs calling with an address in the list.
        Note that this blacklist is not used if a whitelist has been defined in CommonsConfigurator.getIPsWhitelist().

        Subnet notations are supported: 1.1.1.1/255.255.255.255 or 1.1.1.1/32 (CIDR-Notation).

        Specified by:
        getIPsBlacklist in interface CommonsConfigurator
        Returns:
        Empty ArrayList. (No IP addresses are blacklisted.)
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IOException occurs
        SQLException - if a SQLException occurs

      • getIPsWhitelist

        public List<String> getIPsWhitelist()
                             throws IOException,
                                    SQLException
        Description copied from interface: CommonsConfigurator
        Allows to define the whitelist of authorized IP addresses. The server side will grant access only to client programs calling with an address in the list.

        Note that if the whitelist is empty, all client programs will be authorized to access the server side (ServerFileManager or ServerSqlManager Servlet), except those whose IPs is defined in CommonsConfigurator.getIPsBlacklist()

        Subnet notations are supported: 1.1.1.1/255.255.255.255 or 1.1.1.1/32 (CIDR-Notation).

        Specified by:
        getIPsWhitelist in interface CommonsConfigurator
        Returns:
        Empty ArrayList. (All IP addresses are accepted.)
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IOException occurs
        SQLException - if a SQLException occurs

      • login

        public boolean login(String username,
            char[] password)
              throws IOException,
                     SQLException
        Description copied from interface: CommonsConfigurator
        Allows to authenticate the remote (usernname, password) couple sent by the client side.

        The KawanSoft Server will call the method in order to grant or not client access.

        Typical usage would be to check the (username, password) couple against a table in a SQL database or against a LDAP, etc.

        Specified by:
        login in interface CommonsConfigurator
        Parameters:
        username - the username sent by the client login
        password - the password to connect to the server
        Returns:
        true. (Client is always granted access).
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IOException occurs
        SQLException - if a SQLException occurs

      • getConnection

        public Connection getConnection()
                         throws SQLException
        Returns a Connection from Tomcat JDBC Connection Pool.

        How the Connection is extracted depends on KawanSoft framework in use:
        • SQL framework: the Connection is extracted from the DataSource created by the embedded Tomcat JDBC Pool. The JDBC parameters used to create the DataSource are defined in the properties file passed at start-up of the SQL Framework.
        • FILE framework: the Connection is extracted from the DataSource created by an org.apache.tomcat.jdbc.pool.DataSourceFactory factory defined as a 'jdbc/kawanfw-default' Resource in server.xml or context.xml.
          Here is an example: context.xml
        Specified by:
        getConnection in interface CommonsConfigurator
        Returns:
        the Connection extracted from Tomcat JDBC Connection Pool.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if a database access error occurs

      • addSecretForAuthToken

        public String addSecretForAuthToken()
                             throws IOException,
                                    SQLException
        Returns a concatenation of server specific values that won't change during the JVM life and that client side can not guess in order to secure computeAuthToken().

        To ensure very strong security:
        this method should be overidden to return this method return value plus a secret value in your CommonsConfigurator.addSecretForAuthToken() implementation.

        Example: 

         @Override
 public String addSecretForAuthToken() throws IOException, SQLException {
     return (super.addSecretForAuthToken() + "my secret value");
 }
        Specified by:
        addSecretForAuthToken in interface CommonsConfigurator
        Returns:
        the concatenation of some server specific values that won't change during the JVM life and that the client side can not guess: server MAC address + System properties: user.home + os.name + os.version + os.arch + java.class.path + java.endorsed.dirs.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IOException occurs
        SQLException - if a SQLException occurs
        See Also:
        CommonsConfigurator.computeAuthToken(java.lang.String)

      • computeAuthToken

        public String computeAuthToken(String username)
                        throws Exception
        This default method is secure if client side always use SSL/TLS httpS calls.

        You may override the method if you want to create the Authentication Token with your own security rules (adding random values stored in database, etc.)
        Specified by:
        computeAuthToken in interface CommonsConfigurator
        Parameters:
        username - the database user on whose behalf the connection is being made
        Returns:
        SHA-1(username + secretValue) first 20 hexadecimal characters.

        where:
        • username: the username of the client.
        • secretValue: the value returned by addSecretForAuthToken().
        Throws:
        Exception - if any Exception occurs

      • defaultComputeAuthToken

        public static String defaultComputeAuthToken(String username,
                             String secretForAuthToken)
                                      throws Exception
        The default algorithm to use for computing token
        Parameters:
        username - the client side username
        secretForAuthToken - the secret to add
        Returns:
        SHA-1(username + addSecretForAuthToken()) first 20 hexadecimal characters.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any Exception occurs

      • getEncryptionPassword

        public char[] getEncryptionPassword()
        Description copied from interface: CommonsConfigurator
        Allows to define the password that is used to encrypt from the Client all the request parameters values for security reason (obfuscation and transport encryption).
        Specified by:
        getEncryptionPassword in interface CommonsConfigurator
        Returns:
        null. It is highly recommended to override this method in order to set a secret password in order to reinforce the security of the transport of request parameters.

      • getLogger

        public Logger getLogger()
                 throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: CommonsConfigurator
        Returns the Logger that will be used by for logging:
        • All Exceptions thrown by server side will be logged.
        • Exceptions thrown are logged with Level.WARNING.

        It is not necessary nor recommended to implement this method; do it only if you want take control of the logging to modify the default characteristics of getLogger().

        Specified by:
        getLogger in interface CommonsConfigurator
        Returns:
        a Logger whose pattern is located in user.home/.kawansoft/log/kawanfw.log, that uses a SingleLineFormatter and that logs 50Mb into 4 rotating files.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IOException occurs
